content: When you walk into work, how do you know you’re at work? Or at home, or the shops, or your office? That constant feeling of familiarity is a really odd, metacognitive sensation. Without thinking, you know that you know where you are every minute of every day. Imagine if we couldn’t feel familiarity. Everywhere, everywhen, would be a new experience. It would be overwhelming, disorienting, every minute of every day like being a newborn baby who happens to walk, talk, and wipe its own bum.
